channel.title: Comments on: Advanced Smoke Testing with PhantomJS
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Eli Weinstock-Herman (tarwn)
item.dc:creator: Eli Weinstock-Herman (tarwn)
item.content:encoded:
If you run it without parameters, it should give you an error message indicating the format it’s expecting:

Text
1
2
3
4
5

E:\programming\PhantomExperiments\AdvancedSmokeTest [master]> phantomjs.exe test.js
Must pass these 3 args when running script:
 -u [username]
 -p [password]
 -n [displayed user's name]
E:\programming\PhantomExperiments\AdvancedSmokeTest [master]> phantomjs.exe test.js
Must pass these 3 args when running script:
 -u [username]
 -p [password]
 -n [displayed user's name]

So your example would look like this:

Text
1
2
3
4
5

E:\programming\PhantomExperiments\AdvancedSmokeTest [master]> phantomjs.exe test.js -u Testuser1 -p Testuser1 -n Testuser
[OUT] [Step 1         ] Load the site, we won't be logged in
[---] [goToUrl        ] http://lessthandot.com/
[---] [onUrlChanged   ] Going to http://lessthandot.com/
...
E:\programming\PhantomExperiments\AdvancedSmokeTest [master]> phantomjs.exe test.js -u Testuser1 -p Testuser1 -n Testuser
[OUT] [Step 1         ] Load the site, we won't be logged in
[---] [goToUrl        ] http://lessthandot.com/
[---] [onUrlChanged   ] Going to http://lessthandot.com/
...

item.title: By: Arun Sahadeo
item.dc:creator: Arun Sahadeo
item.description: Hi, how do I format the three arguments on the command line? Let's say username was Testuser1 password was Testuser1 and Displayed name was Testuser from example
item.content:encoded: Hi, how do I format the three arguments on the command line? Let’s say username was Testuser1 password was Testuser1 and Displayed name was Testuser from example
